titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the School of Forestry and Environmental Studies, Yale University, Records
School of Forestry and Environmental Studies, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 11:22

did.unittitle: School of Forestry and Environmental Studies, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of class materials and student papers from courses taught at the Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies (School of Forestry prior to 1972) by Edward A. Bowers, Herman H. Chapman, B. E. Fernow, Henry Solon Graves, Gifford Pinchot, and Charles A. Walker. Also included are clippings, biographical notes, letters, publications, and photographs concerning the Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies and its faculty; publications and talks of Carl E. Ostrom, Samuel J. Record and James W. Toumey; and records of Henry W. Hicock concerning alumni relations and his professional work.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. School of Forestry and Environmental Studies

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 24-A (YRG 24-A), Central records and records of the dean of the Yale School of Forestry.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Forestry and Environmental Studies Library, 1991-2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: School of Forestry and Environmental Studies, Yale University, Records (RU 41). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of class materials and student papers from courses taught at the Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies (School of Forestry prior to 1972) by Edward A. Bowers, Herman H. Chapman, B. E. Fernow, Henry Solon Graves, Gifford Pinchot, and Charles A. Walker. Also included are clippings, biographical notes, letters, publications, and photographs concerning the Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies and its faculty; publications and talks of Carl E. Ostrom, Samuel J. Record and James W. Toumey; and records of Henry W. Hicock concerning alumni relations and his professional work.

Scrapbook with captions and photographs of people, forestry practices, and forest reserves in Colorado and Arizona.

Yale Forest School, prepared by Waldo D. Barbour class of 1911. Birch bark covered book (14"X 12") of photos from 1909-12. Photos present detailed documentation of the people and places associated with the Yale Forest School field camps in Milford, PA, Trinity, TX, Mount Carrnel, CT. Includes photographs of sawmills, skidder, and other tools and machinery used at that time.
Loose photographs

Spring Field Work, Yale Forest School 1907-1918. Titles and photographs of people and places at field camps in Spring Valley, Missouri; Woodbridge Ala.; Doucette, Texas; Clarks, LA; Arkansas; Trinity, TX. Examples of turpentining, sawmills. 14 loose negatives.
Publicity materials commemorating the school's centennial

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
